Posts.Content: On Jul 26, 2015 10:15 PM Malauba wrote: On Apr 08, 2014 10:53 PM mnwyrkmaria wrote: It has been almost 3 years since I had my chemo. It has taken me a long time for me to grow my hair back.  My hair has grown a few inches on the back of my head, but the front of my head look almost bald. How can I grow all of my hair back. Please help me. I am very depressed about my hair. Thank you. I am in the same boat as you. I am currently struggling with what I am now. Maybe some one will respond with a solution. In the meanwhile I'm going to try what a lady suggested above. Hi! Are you taking or still taking any kindof estrogen blockers? This can really slow down hair growth. In some cases, it can induce alopecia ... especially with all the emotional turbulence and stress from this time in your life.  There are a couple options for you including getting a micro-analysis of your scalp, scalp/hair treatments, and resting hair programs. I am open to answering any questions privately. <3 Source: currently working with a Hair Recovery Treatment specialist who focuses specifically on women who have undergone chemo
